Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
General Summary

The Analyst, Data I is part of a team that shares the responsibility for success and profitability by providing services to our customers which may include: data warehousing, post audits, reporting, carrier bids management, dashboard creation, project management, transportation analysis, application mastery, consulting support, and data analysis. The Data Analyst works with customers, carriers, and internal employees to analyze and identify cost saving opportunities for customers.

Primary Responsibilities

Manage data gathering for customers’ benchmark key performance metrics.

Create a strategic approach to carrier bids through lane, mode, and service balancing (Bid team) by performing the following tasks: Scorecard and performance tracking, transportation dashboard, on-going analysis of data.

Determine the best mode, carrier, and service for the customer, resulting in customer savings by providing the analysis and metrics for transportation bids.

Use professional judgment to assess the impact of decisions/actions on the customer and the Company which would be approved by both the customer and the person’s leader.

Act as an internal technical resource for role specific applications.

Analyze large amounts of data and then recommend broad based innovative improvement initiatives for customer(s).

Reporting and analyzing on an ad hoc basis for the customer.

Develop customer presentations showing data trends and possible solutions to the customer. Collaborate with the objective of agreeing to the most effective and profitable solution for the customer, carrier, and the Company.

Developing standard operating procedures based on the direction from manager.

Qualifications - External

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Engineering, Accounting/Finance or related field preferred and 0-2 years of relevant experience.

In lieu of degree, high school diploma or GED and 2+ years of relevant experience.

Proficient with technology, specifically Microsoft applications such as Access and Excel.

Experience with SQL is preferred.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with internal and external customers.

Experience or knowledge in transportation, logistics, parcel shipping or freight pay is preferred.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Physical/Cognitive Requirements

With or without accommodation:

Ability to follow policies and procedures.
Ability to read, write and interpret information.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to use hands to manipulate, handle, or feel.
Ability to sit/walk/stand for up to 8 hours per day.
Must possess visual acuity, i.e., close, distance, and color vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Working Conditions

General office environment that is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment with standard office equipment available.

Disclaimer

The above information is only an illustration of the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this classification. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position.

The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the Company and employee and is subject to change by the Company as the needs of the Company and requirements of the job change.




FedEx Supply Chain is an equal opportunity employers. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The FedEx Supply Chain is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in its application procedures, hiring, and other terms and conditions of employment. To request a reasonable accommodation, please contact FSC.TalentAcquisition@fedex.com.

** Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to, market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, education/training and a candidate’s work experience.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL/Tableau/Visualizations/Hive (Hybrid in Fremont, CA)
Description:
Job Description




iTalent Digital is seeking a Data Analyst to join our BI, Data & Analytics practice. 90% of your work will be client focused. 10% of your work will be internal. This role offers an exciting opportunity within one of our esteemed technology and social media clients, focusing on supporting dynamic engagements in the realm of Facilities and Culinary operations.




The role primarily involves creating and maintaining analytics products, reporting, and analytical tasks within the context of Facilities and Culinary operations. The ideal candidate will demonstrate proficiency in Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis, particularly in SQL, Hive, and Tableau, navigating complex data environments and driving BI-centric priorities within these domains.




This position is based in Fremont, CA. We provide comprehensive medical benefits, a 401k plan, paid holidays, and more. Please note that we are only considering direct W2 candidates at this time, as we are unable to offer sponsorship.




This role requires you to work in office in Fremont, CA 3x a week!




Responsibilities:




Create and maintain analytics products to support Facilities and Culinary operations. Support enhancements of existing products and drive efforts to improve efficiencies.
Develop a thorough understanding of spatial, financial, and behavioral data in areas such as Facilities and On-campus services.
Write queries to analyze data and combine disparate sources.
Build dashboards and visualizations for a wide range of operational and executive audiences. Translate requirements into dashboard designs that are informative, polished, and concise.
Utilize your knowledge of the data to answer stakeholder questions with the right sources. Work with urgency on time-sensitive matters without compromising accuracy.
Respond to data quality issues by identifying root causes and proposing solutions with minimal guidance.
Clearly articulate issues, enhancements, and related impacts to both technical teams (data engineering) and non-technical business partners.
Support various cross-functional teams within the Facilities & Culinary division, including:
Culinary Team: Manage day-to-day operations, purchasing, planning spend, and overseeing the number of people fed.
Design Team: Assist in the design and programming of meeting rooms and amenities spaces.
Space Planning Team: Manage occupancy, desk assignments, moving teams, and working on business strategy.
Technical Space Team: Support labs, lab standards, and lab usage.
Transportation Team: Aid in shuttle services, other transportation needs, capacity planning, and commute analysis.




The internal responsibilities will be as follows:

Attend regular internal practice community meetings.
Collaborate with your iTD practice team on industry thought leadership.
Complete client case studies and learning material. (Blogs, media material).
Build out material to contribute to Digital Transformation practice.
Attend internal iTD networking events (in person and virtual).
Work with leadership on career fast-track opportunities.




Required qualifications and skills

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.
4+ years of experience managing, analyzing, and reporting on large data sets.
Strong proficiency in SQL.
Experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards with advanced capabilities such as LOD calculations, data blending/joins, window functions, and parameters.
Fluency in Excel to perform analysis and summarize data into a presentable format.
Experience managing and analyzing data using Hive tables for efficient processing and insightful analysis.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team player.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate complex issues in a clear, concise manner.
Ability to learn, operate, and troubleshoot independently.
Keen attention to detail in the context of numbers (data fidelity) as well as design (dashboard presentation).




Preferred qualifications and skills

Proficiency in developing ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages like Python or R.
Experience in Business Operations, Finance, People Analytics, or Product Analytics.
Experience in addressing data quality issues and translating vague technical issues to non-technical terms.
Ability to work effectively in a hybrid model with in-person attendance required 3 days a week in Fremont, CA.

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.




Company description

About iTalent Digital:

We are part of a new generation of consulting and software development company that blends diversity, innovation, and integrity with real business results. Our structure rejects any strong hierarchy, empowering us to deliver excellent results. We are a woman- and minority-led firm. Every day, we challenge ourselves to be considerate, fair and to re-think what great outcomes mean for our customers. This permeates down to how we approach every interaction, on every project, for every client. You’ll thrive here if you are a dynamic self-starter, a difference-maker or someone who wants to deliver great results, without constraints.

The iTalent Digital Experience:​

Joining us means you’ll be part of our global community, you have a say about your own career journey, and you’ll get a chance to give back to causes that matter. You will experience working with Fortune 500 companies and high-performance teams across numerous industries.

iTalent Digital offers our employees excellent benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays, PTO, 401K + matching, networking & career learning and development programs. We are growing and we want to see you grow!​

​

Visit https://www.italentdigital.com/careers to learn more about what working at iTalent can mean for you.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

iTalent is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact us at recruiting@italentdigital.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Additional info

Dynamic environment in a culture of respect, empowerment and recognition for a job well done, apply today!

The iTalent Digital Experience:​

Joining us means you’ll be part of our global community, you have a say about your own career journey, and you’ll get a chance to give back to causes that matter. You will experience working with Fortune 500 companies and high-performance teams across numerous industries.

iTalent Digital offers our employees excellent benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays, PTO, 401K + matching, networking & career learning and development programs. We are growing and we want to see you grow!​

​

Visit https://www.italentdigital.com/careers to learn more about what working at iTalent can mean for you.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

iTalent is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact us at recruiting@italentdigital.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Additional info

Dynamic environment in a culture of respect, empowerment and recognition for a job well done, apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RANE is hiring a Data Analyst to support our growing Data Operations team. This is a hybrid role where the Data Analyst will have dual responsibilities across our Data Operations and Development teams. The Analyst will gain broad exposure to various aspects of RANE’s product offerings and will play an integral role in creating and maintaining data across the RANE organization.

 

The Data Analyst’s primary responsibilities will be to create queries and dashboards related to usage metrics, analyze usage data for stakeholders, and assist in the integration of artificial intelligence with our content improvement processes. In this position, the Analyst will play an integral in creating visualization dashboards for broader dissemination of usage metrics across RANE. The Data Analyst is also responsible for analyzing customer data to identify platform usage trends for the analyst, product and sales team to make more informed decisions. They will also play a key role in ensuring that our machine learning/AI processes continue to meet RANE’s quality standards.

 

This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing, B2B startup serving the dynamic market for enterprise risk management. 

 

This position is remote, preferably on the East Coast, with a preference for candidates based in the New England to New York area.

‍

‍Job Responsibilities Include:

Running existing database queries
Creating queries for custom database reports
Creating data visualizations to be used by executive, sales, product and analyst teams
Analyzing data for trend identification
Collaborating across data operations, product, development and quality assurance teams

Desired Skills and Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering or another technical discipline
Fluent in English
Working knowledge of AWS, elastic search, Python, basic shell scripting
Experience writing queries against Elasticsearch, including aggregating over multiple attributes
Experience writing complex SQL queries for MySQL database, like aggregate and pivot over multiple fields
Experience converting JSON to CSV file format conversions
Experience working in data collection, analysis and quality control
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or similar platforms
Intermediate excel skills, ability to perform SUM, IF, VLOOKUP, DATE and TEXT functions
Detail-oriented research and analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work collaboratively and effectively across multiple internal teams and stakeholders

‍

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at RANE. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst, Business Intelligence
Description:
Req Id: 419499

At Bell, our purpose is to advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world. We achieve this by providing consumers and businesses with the best network technologies in the world, innovative digital solutions and seamless customer experiences. It’s all developed and delivered by the members of #TeamBell and we’re always on the lookout for people with great skills and experiences.

We value diversity and provide a supportive, inclusive community where all team members can succeed. And through our commitment to environmental, social and governance initiatives, you will feel good about the greater impact you will have – making every day better for people as they connect, work, learn and play.

Join us. You belong at Bell.

Summary

Bell’s Business Intelligence (BI) Group is responsible for the management and optimization of BI data, systems, and analytics used to create marketing contact strategies, analyze customer behaviour, automate business insight processes and provide insight to drive business decisions.

This is an excellent opportunity for the right person to join our team and play a key role transforming the organization. If you enjoy working with the latest analytics tools and technologies to apply various analysis techniques then this may be the right job for you!

Our people are making big things happen across the country, nourished constantly by growth, training and personal development opportunities. Our passionate, dedicated leaders encourage and empower people to grow and succeed.

Key Responsibilities


This is an Agile development environment, working with the latest BI visualization tools and technologies
Working with a team of BI analysts whilst helping to maintain and build new reporting analytical capabilities
Analysis, delivery of business requests/issues/requirements, and conducting quality assurance testing for all BI deliverables supporting Sales & Marketing business functions
Excellent leadership and communication skills required to work well with business users, other analysis teams, development teams, and IT teams
Deliver on key projects and data strategies that directly support key business drivers
Work with and opportunity to present to various management levels
Maintain and expand your knowledge of BI and current technology through training opportunities


Critical Qualifications


You have a Bachelors degree, or Masters with minimal work experience, in a discipline such as:
Business analytics / business intelligence
applied math,
computer science,
applied science / engineering,
economics/econometrics,
Commerce
management science / operations research
or related area
You have knowledge of, and experience with, SQL, SAS, and data visualization tools
You are highly analytical and understand the basic principles of working with large and complex data sets
You have the ability to leverage insights and opportunities from data and metrics to build strategies and make recommendations
You have the ability to work with a team towards common goals
You are able to manage multiple projects and priorities.
You are a self starter who is comfortable working with and presenting to all management levels (Junior to EVP)

Preferred Qualifications


Experience with data systems such as Oracle, SQL Server, Teradata, SAS, MicroStrategy or others
Experience with BI and data warehouse technologies
Basic working knowledge of project management steps
Experience in Telecommunications


#EmployeeReferralProgram

Adequate knowledge of French is required for positions in Quebec.

Additional Information

Position Type: ManagementJob Status: Regular - Full TimeJob Location: Canada : Ontario : Mississauga

Work Arrangement: Hybrid

Application Deadline: 08/09/2024

For work arrangements that are ‘Hybrid’, successful candidates must be based in Canada and report to a set Bell office for a minimum of 3 days a week. Recognizing the importance of work-life balance, Bell offers flexibility in work hours based on the business needs.

Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted.

We know that caring for our team members is at the heart of a healthy, positive and thriving workplace. As part of our team, you’ll enjoy a comprehensive compensation package that includes a competitive salary and a wide range of benefits to support the well-being of you and your family. As soon as you join us, you'll be eligible for medical, dental, vision and mental health benefits that you can tailor to your specific needs. Plus, as a Bell team member, you'll enjoy a 35% discount on our services and access exclusive offers from our partners.

We value the experiences that have shaped who you are, and we know the diversity of your talent will bring even greater strength to our team. At Bell, everyone belongs and you’ll feel valued, respected and supported as you grow and reach your full potential.

We also want to make sure that everyone has an equal opportunity to join our team. We encourage individuals who may require accommodations during the hiring process to let us know. For a confidential inquiry, email your recruiter or recruitment@bell.ca to make arrangements. If you have questions or feedback regarding accessibility at Bell, we invite you to complete the Accessibility feedback form or visit our Accessibility page for other ways to contact us.

Artificial intelligence may be used to assess parts of your application. Please review our privacy policy (see Phenom for details) to learn more about how we collect, use, and disclose your personal information.

Created: Canada, ON, Toronto

Bell, one of Canada's Top 100 Employers.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Required Skills:

Python, BigQuery, SQL, Google DataStudio , Looker Studio , Tableau, Google Cloud, Airflow




Good to have:

Plx platform(Tables, scripts, workflows, dashboard), query engines(Dremel, F1), DataBridge, Dataproc, Dataflow, App Engine, Cloud Spanner, Cloud BigTable, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, Borg, Blaze




Responsibilities:

Building end-to-end core infrastructure and data pipelines for collection, transformation and aggregation, of key data assets which acts as the single source of truth for Global Cloud Bookings and Revenue, used across Google Cloud teams powering global reporting, analytics as well as Partner and Googler commissions.
Created data pipelines to automatically import data from Data Layer, upload to external Anaplan system, trigger anaplan pipelines, add process to load forecast data across various anaplan workspace ad models, validate and publish forecast data, which is used across Google Cloud, for monthly forecast and quarterly accrual.
Involved in various migrations of this Data warehouse, to reduce time and improve data accuracy, quality and reliability by 80%, to resolve issues and improve customer experience, which helped the growth of Google Enterprise business.

  • Created data pipelines to automatically import data from Data Layer, upload to external Anaplan system, trigger anaplan pipelines, add process to load forecast data across various anaplan workspace ad models, validate and publish forecast data, which is used across Google Cloud, for monthly forecast and quarterly accrual.
  • Involved in various migrations of this Data warehouse, to reduce time and improve data accuracy, quality and reliability by 80%, to resolve issues and improve customer experience, which helped the growth of Google Enterprise business.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
THE ROLE

As a Data Analyst at Sofar, you’ll be a data partner with leaders across the business. You’ll build dashboards that provide crucial insights into business performance, create reports and run analyses that uncover stories about where our efforts are having the most impact, and help us understand key levers to unlock future growth.

We have a considerably large pool of data, so you’ll help keep everything clean and digestible, working with engineering to make sure we’re ingesting and structuring data in sustainable ways.

Because the work is critical for our company, we’re looking for someone who truly understands how to use data to influence business strategy. You’ll be a driving force behind our growth and help our team do what we do best – putting on incredible concerts around the world.




What you’ll do:
You’ll build dashboards that give key department leaders insight into business performance and levers we can pull to drive growth
You’ll run analyses and tell actionable stories with data, extracting key points and sharing complex learnings in easy-to-digest ways
You’ll partner with folks across the business to help us better understand supply and demand, providing insight into the relationship between inventory, sales projections, user retention
You’ll expose the interaction between marketing channels and traffic sources, including but not limited to email, search, social media, and bespoke local city promotional efforts
You’ll help publish data in easy to consume, understandable ways that allow stakeholders to self-service some of their data needs
You’ll be a champion of our analytic abilities, while ensuring accurate and ethical use of data





Who you are:
You have 4+ years of experience as an in-house Analyst (across Data, Growth, Business Intelligence, Marketing, etc.) at a high growth e-commerce B2C company
You know how to effectively collaborate with teams and stakeholders to determine best approaches to measurement
You have a track record of generating plausible hypotheses on business drivers and validating them with data
You have strong knowledge of SQL – bonus points for Redshift, BigQuery, or Postgres, and analytics-focused platforms like Jupyter or R-Studio
You have experience with Metabase, Looker, PowerBI, or other common data visualization tools
You understand supply and demand modeling and forecasting
You are eligible for employment in the US, preferably within 2 hours of the East Coast time zone
Most importantly: you have a passion for growth, are naturally curious, and know how to get things done!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst, Customer Success

Location: 100% Remote or Local Hybrid in Cincinnati, Ohio







Overview: The Data Analyst, Customer Success, plays a crucial role in extracting, analyzing, and interpreting data to enhance our customer journey and streamline operations. Reporting to the VP of Customer Success, this position focuses on delivering performance insights and quantitative analyses to drive customer success and portfolio growth.




Key Responsibilities:

Extract and gather data from various sources to support portfolio analysis and ensure data quality.
Collect and report on customer success metrics on a weekly and quarterly basis.
Compile operations metrics and generate regular reports, including developing dashboard reports in JIRA.
Support business intelligence initiatives through detailed quantitative analysis.
Create visual data representations to communicate findings effectively.
Develop initial data sets for the data vault, tailored to meet business needs.
Assist in creating automated reporting solutions for customer and operations data.
Work cross-functionally to develop data-driven strategies that enhance business and operational efficiency.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
5-7 years of experience in business data analysis and deriving insights.
Strong background in data extraction, statistical analysis, and report creation.




Technical Skills:

Expertise in SQL, Python, Tableau, Alteryx, Microsoft Power BI, R, and MATLAB.




Ideal Team Member:

Collaborative and willing to pitch in where needed.
Possesses a good sense of humor.
Demonstrates a proactive, solution-oriented mindset.
Thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced start-up environment.




Personal Attributes:

Capable of managing multiple priorities, complex projects, and high-profile clients.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to present data clearly.
Strong interpersonal skills to effectively interact with stakeholders and customers.
Keen attention to detail and outstanding organizational abilities.
Proficient in data visualization and reporting techniques.

Title: Data Analyst (Business Intelligence)
Description:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will join a driven, collaborative team within an ambitious, entrepreneurial global organization. You will work collaboratively within the Data & Analytics team supporting internal reporting for Global Client Services. This role requires a proactive individual who takes ownership of all assigned work and thrives in a collaborative team environment.

We pride ourselves on being a positive work environment, and place value on a work/life balance. This means thoughtful, sustainable workloads, as well as professional development opportunities to help you reach your career goals.

We are currently hiring out of the following office location(s):


Cherry Hill, NJ
Downers Grove, IL


This role may be eligible for voluntary work-from-home consideration. In order to be considered for this position, you should live within a commutable distance to one of these office locations, even if you plan to request a work-from-home arrangement, as there may be times when in-person meetings, training sessions, social events, or similar activities are held onsite.

This key position reports to the Director, Source-to-Pay Data & Analytics within our Advisory team. We're a dedicated, down-to-earth group in a growing organization offering plenty of opportunity. We look forward to adding you into the mix!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will:


Handle diverse data inputs and transform them into valuable insights, demonstrating strong data organization and cleansing skills, ensuring that data is presented in a format that is clear and accessible to team members.
Utilize tools and techniques to clean and standardize data, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and identify key outcomes for reporting.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders (technical and non-technical) in clear and concise formats
Demonstrate exceptional communication skills, documenting and articulating findings and action items



Requirements

You'll need to have:


Bachelor's or Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Business Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience with business intelligence software such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik.
Excellent communication skills, written and verbal (English).
Knowledge in Programming Languages (SQL, Python) for querying and manipulating data stored in databases
Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality reporting
A strong work ethic, self-motivation and progressive thinking, thriving on new challenges.
Ability to self-manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects.


(We want to make sure you're set up to succeed, and we view these as the critical skills you'll need to achieve great things at Corcentric!)

As we continue to grow our Advisory practice, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, we would like to communicate the following:


We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them
We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth minded
We prioritize both the process and outcome of work, demonstrating a strong commitment to the success of our customers and colleagues. Exceptional quality work is an essential standard for us.
We operate within a voluntary work-from-home framework, yet we uphold the same level of accountability and responsibility as in a traditional office setting



About Us

Corcentric is a global provider of business spend management and revenue management software and services for mid-market and Fortune 1000 businesses. Corcentric delivers software, advisory services, and payments focused on reducing costs, optimizing working capital, and unlocking revenue.

We achieve success by exemplifying our core values in the way we work, communicate, and collaborate:


Do the Right Thing
Embrace + Drive Change
Be Empowered
Be Relentlessly Focused on the Customer



Benefits

At Corcentric, we know that the hard work of our employees is what drives the success of our organization. We care about who you are and what you value, both inside and outside of work.

Within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with smart, collaborative team members and approachable leaders. Our down-to-earth, solutions-oriented culture means you'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with interesting work projects and be able to draw a short line from your contributions to business impacts. We prioritize professional development and encourage cross-functional promotional opportunities to enable you to reach your career goals. We have been in business for over 25 years and are thrilled to be actively growing and scaling our teams accordingly - it's an exciting environment and a great time to join.

We also recognize the importance of work-life balance and want to support your efforts to take care of your health and well-being and the health and well-being of those who depend upon you. In support of this, we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to our full-time team members, including:


Generous annual paid time off program that increases with tenure
Nine paid holidays plus an annual personal holiday to recognize or celebrate an occasion that is important to you
An annual paid day off to volunteer for causes that are near and dear to you
Paid maternity, paternal/secondary caregiver, and adoptive parent leave
Company-paid life and disability insurance
401k program with a company match
Medical insurance plan options ranging from a traditional PPO to High Deductible Health Plan options that feature a company HSA contribution
Dental plan - including orthodontia coverage
Vision plan - including discount for LASIK surgery
All medical, dental, and vision insurance plans are available from the first of the month following your start date - no extended waiting period to be eligible!
A no-cost Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 access to confidential counseling services and a wide range of additional support and professional services


Our roles require routine use of standard office equipment, such as computers, keyboards, printers, phones, and filing cabinets. You may need to type, reach, and lift office materials of a reasonable weight. Travel may also be required based on job responsibilities and business needs.

Corcentric does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.
Show more
HTML:
As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will join a driven, collaborative team within an ambitious, entrepreneurial global organization. You will work collaboratively within the Data & Analytics team supporting internal reporting for Global Client Services. This role requires a proactive individual who takes ownership of all assigned work and thrives in a collaborative team environment.

We pride ourselves on being a positive work environment, and place value on a work/life balance. This means thoughtful, sustainable workloads, as well as professional development opportunities to help you reach your career goals.

We are currently hiring out of the following office location(s):

  • Cherry Hill, NJ
  • Downers Grove, IL

This role may be eligible for voluntary work-from-home consideration. In order to be considered for this position, you should live within a commutable distance to one of these office locations, even if you plan to request a work-from-home arrangement, as there may be times when in-person meetings, training sessions, social events, or similar activities are held onsite.

This key position reports to the Director, Source-to-Pay Data & Analytics within our Advisory team. We're a dedicated, down-to-earth group in a growing organization offering plenty of opportunity. We look forward to adding you into the mix!

As a Business Intelligence Analyst, you will:

  • Handle diverse data inputs and transform them into valuable insights, demonstrating strong data organization and cleansing skills, ensuring that data is presented in a format that is clear and accessible to team members.
  • Utilize tools and techniques to clean and standardize data, ensuring accuracy and consistency.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and identify key outcomes for reporting.
  • Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders (technical and non-technical) in clear and concise formats
  • Demonstrate exceptional communication skills, documenting and articulating findings and action items


Requirements

You'll need to have:

  • Bachelor's or Master's in Mathematics, Statistics, Analytics, Business Information Systems, or a related field.
  • Proven experience with business intelligence software such as Power BI, Tableau, Qlik.
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal (English).
  • Knowledge in Programming Languages (SQL, Python) for querying and manipulating data stored in databases
  • Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high quality reporting
  • A strong work ethic, self-motivation and progressive thinking, thriving on new challenges.
  • Ability to self-manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects.

(We want to make sure you're set up to succeed, and we view these as the critical skills you'll need to achieve great things at Corcentric!)

As we continue to grow our Advisory practice, we are looking for the right people to join us on our mission. If you are interested in being part of our team, we would like to communicate the following:

  • We are energized by challenges and the effort needed to solve them
  • We like working with people who are positive, adaptable and growth minded
  • We prioritize both the process and outcome of work, demonstrating a strong commitment to the success of our customers and colleagues. Exceptional quality work is an essential standard for us.
  • We operate within a voluntary work-from-home framework, yet we uphold the same level of accountability and responsibility as in a traditional office setting


About Us

Corcentric is a global provider of business spend management and revenue management software and services for mid-market and Fortune 1000 businesses. Corcentric delivers software, advisory services, and payments focused on reducing costs, optimizing working capital, and unlocking revenue.

We achieve success by exemplifying our core values in the way we work, communicate, and collaborate:

  • Do the Right Thing
  • Embrace + Drive Change
  • Be Empowered
  • Be Relentlessly Focused on the Customer


Benefits

At Corcentric, we know that the hard work of our employees is what drives the success of our organization. We care about who you are and what you value, both inside and outside of work.

Within our organization, you will have the opportunity to work with smart, collaborative team members and approachable leaders. Our down-to-earth, solutions-oriented culture means you'll have the opportunity to get hands-on with interesting work projects and be able to draw a short line from your contributions to business impacts. We prioritize professional development and encourage cross-functional promotional opportunities to enable you to reach your career goals. We have been in business for over 25 years and are thrilled to be actively growing and scaling our teams accordingly - it's an exciting environment and a great time to join.

We also recognize the importance of work-life balance and want to support your efforts to take care of your health and well-being and the health and well-being of those who depend upon you. In support of this, we are proud to offer a comprehensive benefits package to our full-time team members, including:

  • Generous annual paid time off program that increases with tenure
  • Nine paid holidays plus an annual personal holiday to recognize or celebrate an occasion that is important to you
  • An annual paid day off to volunteer for causes that are near and dear to you
  • Paid maternity, paternal/secondary caregiver, and adoptive parent leave
  • Company-paid life and disability insurance
  • 401k program with a company match
  • Medical insurance plan options ranging from a traditional PPO to High Deductible Health Plan options that feature a company HSA contribution
  • Dental plan - including orthodontia coverage
  • Vision plan - including discount for LASIK surgery
  • All medical, dental, and vision insurance plans are available from the first of the month following your start date - no extended waiting period to be eligible!
  • A no-cost Employee Assistance Program - 24/7 access to confidential counseling services and a wide range of additional support and professional services

Our roles require routine use of standard office equipment, such as computers, keyboards, printers, phones, and filing cabinets. You may need to type, reach, and lift office materials of a reasonable weight. Travel may also be required based on job responsibilities and business needs.

Corcentric does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

Title: Analista de Data & Analytics
Description:
El rol apoya con La administración y disponibilidad de los datos de forma confiable y oportuna a las áreas de negocio a través de las plataformas tecnológicas.







Responsabilidades:




Desarrollar mejoras al modelo de Data WareHouse
Configurar estructuras tecnológicas y administración de plataformas internas
Gestionar los datos e indicadores relevantes para la toma de decisiones de áreas clave
Evaluar el uso y el desempeño de las herramientas que dan soporte en la generación de modelos de datos y analítica







Requisitos:




Licenciatura en Actuaría, Informática, o similar (titulado)
Experiencia similar mínima de 1 año
Inglés conversacional
Conocimiento intermedio de SQL y Python (indispensable)
Experiencia deseable en SAS







Importante: El equipo de Atracción de Talento de Aeroméxico se identificará debidamente y nunca te solicitará pagos ni datos bancarios durante el proceso de selección. Consulta nuestras vacantes únicamente a través de canales oficiales.

Title: Data Analyst I
Description:
General Summary

The Analyst, Data I is part of a team that shares the responsibility for success and profitability by providing services to our customers which may include: data warehousing, post audits, reporting, carrier bids management, dashboard creation, project management, transportation analysis, application mastery, consulting support, and data analysis. The Data Analyst works with customers, carriers, and internal employees to analyze and identify cost saving opportunities for customers.

Primary Responsibilities

Manage data gathering for customers’ benchmark key performance metrics.

Create a strategic approach to carrier bids through lane, mode, and service balancing (Bid team) by performing the following tasks: Scorecard and performance tracking, transportation dashboard, on-going analysis of data.

Determine the best mode, carrier, and service for the customer, resulting in customer savings by providing the analysis and metrics for transportation bids.

Use professional judgment to assess the impact of decisions/actions on the customer and the Company which would be approved by both the customer and the person’s leader.

Act as an internal technical resource for role specific applications.

Analyze large amounts of data and then recommend broad based innovative improvement initiatives for customer(s).

Reporting and analyzing on an ad hoc basis for the customer.

Develop customer presentations showing data trends and possible solutions to the customer. Collaborate with the objective of agreeing to the most effective and profitable solution for the customer, carrier, and the Company.

Developing standard operating procedures based on the direction from manager.

Qualifications - External

Education/Experience

Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Engineering, Accounting/Finance or related field preferred and 0-2 years of relevant experience.

In lieu of degree, high school diploma or GED and 2+ years of relevant experience.

Proficient with technology, specifically Microsoft applications such as Access and Excel.

Experience with SQL is preferred.

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with multiple deadlines.

Strong organizational skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.

Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work with internal and external customers.

Experience or knowledge in transportation, logistics, parcel shipping or freight pay is preferred.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Physical/Cognitive Requirements

With or without accommodation:

Ability to follow policies and procedures.
Ability to read, write and interpret information.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide.
Ability to use hands to manipulate, handle, or feel.
Ability to sit/walk/stand for up to 8 hours per day.
Must possess visual acuity, i.e., close, distance, and color vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Working Conditions

General office environment that is generally favorable. Lighting and temperature are adequate, and there are no hazardous or unpleasant conditions caused by noise, dust, etc. Work is generally performed within an office environment with standard office equipment available.

Disclaimer

The above information is only an illustration of the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this classification. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related or a logical assignment to the position.

The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the Company and employee and is subject to change by the Company as the needs of the Company and requirements of the job change.




FedEx Supply Chain is an equal opportunity employers. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics. The FedEx Supply Chain is committed to providing access, equal opportunity, and reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities in its application procedures, hiring, and other terms and conditions of employment. To request a reasonable accommodation, please contact FSC.TalentAcquisition@fedex.com.

** Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to, market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, education/training and a candidate’s work experience.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Hybrid on-site at downtown, Cincinnati office (M/T/W)

*12-month contract with chance of extension




The Process and Data Analyst will be responsible for the day-to-day management of data, including gathering, summarizing, and analyzing data that the team deems necessary for process improvement, best practices development and implementation. Identify and communicate any data related issues/recommendations to the team, so they can quickly develop a resolution.




Qualifications:

• 1 year of analytical experience or equivalent

• Associate degree in related field or relevant experience

• Intermediate knowledge in R or Python

• Basic knowledge in SQL

• Knowledge of Oracle, Business Objects, Essbase, Power Bi, Power Automate, MDX, and information retrieval programs.

• Knowledge of Lean Tools and Methodology

• Knowledge of Store Operations, including observations, performance measurements, and summarizing observations.

• Financial, Data, and Statistical Analysis

• Advanced proficiency in Microsoft: Excel, PivotTables, Macros, Charts PowerPoint




Responsibilities:

• Identify and communicate any data-related issues and recommendations to the business owner, assistant process change manager, senior process specialist and the team.

• Create management capabilities and processes that sustain continuous improvement.

• Develop and maintain store and department savings estimate model and database.

• Maintain store and department-level database.

• Perform selected/required key analysis as needed.

• Export and summarize data from corporate/division systems as needed.

• Travel as needed to store or other off-site locations.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




The successful candidate will work closely with divisions across our organization and the group to provide actionable insights and make data-driven decisions.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Collaborate with key stakeholders across divisions, ETO, and the group to capture business requirements and translate them into technical needs.
Develop, implement, and maintain databases, data collection systems, data analytics, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
Interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques, providing ongoing reports.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and clean data, and review computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems.
Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.
Maintain data security and confidentiality in all tasks.
Communicate effectively with various stakeholders at different levels within the organization, presenting findings and making recommendations.

Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field.
Have a deep understanding of systems and data architecture, design, and integrations.
Proven working experience as a Data Analyst or Business Data Analyst.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL, etc.), programming (XML, JavaScript, or ETL frameworks), and reporting packages (Business Objects, Power BI, etc.).
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS, etc.).
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Adept at queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Title: Data Analyst - SQL/Tableau/Visualizations/Hive (Hybrid in Fremont, CA)
Description:
Job Description




iTalent Digital is seeking a Data Analyst to join our BI, Data & Analytics practice. 90% of your work will be client focused. 10% of your work will be internal. This role offers an exciting opportunity within one of our esteemed technology and social media clients, focusing on supporting dynamic engagements in the realm of Facilities and Culinary operations.




The role primarily involves creating and maintaining analytics products, reporting, and analytical tasks within the context of Facilities and Culinary operations. The ideal candidate will demonstrate proficiency in Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis, particularly in SQL, Hive, and Tableau, navigating complex data environments and driving BI-centric priorities within these domains.




This position is based in Fremont, CA. We provide comprehensive medical benefits, a 401k plan, paid holidays, and more. Please note that we are only considering direct W2 candidates at this time, as we are unable to offer sponsorship.




This role requires you to work in office in Fremont, CA 3x a week!




Responsibilities:




Create and maintain analytics products to support Facilities and Culinary operations. Support enhancements of existing products and drive efforts to improve efficiencies.
Develop a thorough understanding of spatial, financial, and behavioral data in areas such as Facilities and On-campus services.
Write queries to analyze data and combine disparate sources.
Build dashboards and visualizations for a wide range of operational and executive audiences. Translate requirements into dashboard designs that are informative, polished, and concise.
Utilize your knowledge of the data to answer stakeholder questions with the right sources. Work with urgency on time-sensitive matters without compromising accuracy.
Respond to data quality issues by identifying root causes and proposing solutions with minimal guidance.
Clearly articulate issues, enhancements, and related impacts to both technical teams (data engineering) and non-technical business partners.
Support various cross-functional teams within the Facilities & Culinary division, including:
Culinary Team: Manage day-to-day operations, purchasing, planning spend, and overseeing the number of people fed.
Design Team: Assist in the design and programming of meeting rooms and amenities spaces.
Space Planning Team: Manage occupancy, desk assignments, moving teams, and working on business strategy.
Technical Space Team: Support labs, lab standards, and lab usage.
Transportation Team: Aid in shuttle services, other transportation needs, capacity planning, and commute analysis.




The internal responsibilities will be as follows:

Attend regular internal practice community meetings.
Collaborate with your iTD practice team on industry thought leadership.
Complete client case studies and learning material. (Blogs, media material).
Build out material to contribute to Digital Transformation practice.
Attend internal iTD networking events (in person and virtual).
Work with leadership on career fast-track opportunities.




Required qualifications and skills

Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.
4+ years of experience managing, analyzing, and reporting on large data sets.
Strong proficiency in SQL.
Experience building and maintaining Tableau dashboards with advanced capabilities such as LOD calculations, data blending/joins, window functions, and parameters.
Fluency in Excel to perform analysis and summarize data into a presentable format.
Experience managing and analyzing data using Hive tables for efficient processing and insightful analysis.
Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work as a team player.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate complex issues in a clear, concise manner.
Ability to learn, operate, and troubleshoot independently.
Keen attention to detail in the context of numbers (data fidelity) as well as design (dashboard presentation).




Preferred qualifications and skills

Proficiency in developing ETL processes.
Experience with scripting languages like Python or R.
Experience in Business Operations, Finance, People Analytics, or Product Analytics.
Experience in addressing data quality issues and translating vague technical issues to non-technical terms.
Ability to work effectively in a hybrid model with in-person attendance required 3 days a week in Fremont, CA.

Education

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.




Company description

About iTalent Digital:

We are part of a new generation of consulting and software development company that blends diversity, innovation, and integrity with real business results. Our structure rejects any strong hierarchy, empowering us to deliver excellent results. We are a woman- and minority-led firm. Every day, we challenge ourselves to be considerate, fair and to re-think what great outcomes mean for our customers. This permeates down to how we approach every interaction, on every project, for every client. You’ll thrive here if you are a dynamic self-starter, a difference-maker or someone who wants to deliver great results, without constraints.

The iTalent Digital Experience:​

Joining us means you’ll be part of our global community, you have a say about your own career journey, and you’ll get a chance to give back to causes that matter. You will experience working with Fortune 500 companies and high-performance teams across numerous industries.

iTalent Digital offers our employees excellent benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays, PTO, 401K + matching, networking & career learning and development programs. We are growing and we want to see you grow!​

​

Visit https://www.italentdigital.com/careers to learn more about what working at iTalent can mean for you.




All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

iTalent is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact us at recruiting@italentdigital.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Additional info

Dynamic environment in a culture of respect, empowerment and recognition for a job well done, apply today!

  • Experience in addressing data quality issues and translating vague technical issues to non-technical terms.
  • Ability to work effectively in a hybrid model with in-person attendance required 3 days a week in Fremont, CA.

Education

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related work experience in the field.


Company description

About iTalent Digital:

We are part of a new generation of consulting and software development company that blends diversity, innovation, and integrity with real business results. Our structure rejects any strong hierarchy, empowering us to deliver excellent results. We are a woman- and minority-led firm. Every day, we challenge ourselves to be considerate, fair and to re-think what great outcomes mean for our customers. This permeates down to how we approach every interaction, on every project, for every client. You’ll thrive here if you are a dynamic self-starter, a difference-maker or someone who wants to deliver great results, without constraints.

The iTalent Digital Experience:​

Joining us means you’ll be part of our global community, you have a say about your own career journey, and you’ll get a chance to give back to causes that matter. You will experience working with Fortune 500 companies and high-performance teams across numerous industries.

iTalent Digital offers our employees excellent benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life insurance, paid holidays, PTO, 401K + matching, networking & career learning and development programs. We are growing and we want to see you grow!​

​

Visit https://www.italentdigital.com/careers to learn more about what working at iTalent can mean for you.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

iTalent is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, or to perform the essential functions of a position, please contact us at recruiting@italentdigital.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information.

Additional info

Dynamic environment in a culture of respect, empowerment and recognition for a job well done, apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
RANE is hiring a Data Analyst to support our growing Data Operations team. This is a hybrid role where the Data Analyst will have dual responsibilities across our Data Operations and Development teams. The Analyst will gain broad exposure to various aspects of RANE’s product offerings and will play an integral role in creating and maintaining data across the RANE organization.

 

The Data Analyst’s primary responsibilities will be to create queries and dashboards related to usage metrics, analyze usage data for stakeholders, and assist in the integration of artificial intelligence with our content improvement processes. In this position, the Analyst will play an integral in creating visualization dashboards for broader dissemination of usage metrics across RANE. The Data Analyst is also responsible for analyzing customer data to identify platform usage trends for the analyst, product and sales team to make more informed decisions. They will also play a key role in ensuring that our machine learning/AI processes continue to meet RANE’s quality standards.

 

This is a great opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a fast-growing, B2B startup serving the dynamic market for enterprise risk management. 

 

This position is remote, preferably on the East Coast, with a preference for candidates based in the New England to New York area.

‍

‍Job Responsibilities Include:

Running existing database queries
Creating queries for custom database reports
Creating data visualizations to be used by executive, sales, product and analyst teams
Analyzing data for trend identification
Collaborating across data operations, product, development and quality assurance teams

Desired Skills and Requirements:

Bachelor's Degree in computer science, software engineering, computer engineering or another technical discipline
Fluent in English
Working knowledge of AWS, elastic search, Python, basic shell scripting
Experience writing queries against Elasticsearch, including aggregating over multiple attributes
Experience writing complex SQL queries for MySQL database, like aggregate and pivot over multiple fields
Experience converting JSON to CSV file format conversions
Experience working in data collection, analysis and quality control
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations in Tableau or similar platforms
Intermediate excel skills, ability to perform SUM, IF, VLOOKUP, DATE and TEXT functions
Detail-oriented research and analytical skills
Strong interpersonal skills, ability to work collaboratively and effectively across multiple internal teams and stakeholders

‍

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at RANE. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

PURPOSE:

Contract to Hire role.

Data Analyst need to provide Tier 1 support for EDI claims.

Claims Processing – new plan onboarding this year and need extra help. Help desk, EDI claims transactions, monitoring of different applications.

Shift Hours: 9 AM – 5 PM

100% remote, may need to go to DC office on quarterly basis

Location -- DMV – MD, DC, VA and WV

Interview Process: Final round will be an-person @ DC Office.


Production support – analysis of EDI claims, 837 EDI, how claims processing works – MUST HAVE
Claims processing, EDI transactions, claims from external plans, claims can be errored out
Analysis of EDI transactions, why claims have errored out and resolving issues
Ready to work on manual things – creating incidents and following up with different teams and seeing through resolution, 99 ERRORS – MUST HAVE
Look into issues and create a ticket and do a follow-up within the bridge
When ticket is open, understand the ticket and route it to appropriate team or resolve it.
Training will be given on how to create incidents. ServiceNow is utilized fot tickets. Creation of incidents and seeing it through resolution.
Having knowledge on monitoring – Dyntrace and Jenkins is what CF is using. – MUST HAVE
Understanding monitoring of applications. DO NOT NEED Dynatrace and Jenkins. Understanding of monitoring applications
Knowledge of SQL and running queries – MUST HAVE


Skills: Healthcare and EDI transactions

Education Level: Bachelor's Degree

Experience: 3 years of data analysis or relevant work experience.

In Lieu of Education:In lieu of a Bachelor's degree, an additional 4 years of relevant work experience is required in addition to the required work experience.

***Lumen and / or its clients will not provide equipment (Laptop, monitor, etc.) to the selected contractor. The contractor must have their own equipment. Access to a virtual desktop set up (software) will be provided by Lumen’s client, allowing the user access to the required systems and technology. ***

Lumen Solutions Group Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in employment on the basis of Minority/Gender/Disability/Religion/LGBTQI/Age/Veterans.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Blue Chip Talent is an award-winning, woman-owned staffing company that works hard to “Advance Careers Daily”.




We pride ourselves on building lasting relationships. We do this through our unique ongoing touchpoint program, personalized orientation, bi-yearly appreciation lunches, company-sponsored charitable events, and our flagship family Woodward Dream Cruise event.




We also offer industry-leading benefit options:

Four (4) healthcare plans to choose from

PTO & Paid Holidays
Dental & Vision insurance
Company-paid life insurance
Long and short-term disability
401k with yearly arbitrary match
Pet insurance




You can count on Blue Chip Talent to be your reliable career coach and advocate. We look forward to connecting with you and guiding you on your career goals.




Summary

The ideal candidate will be responsible for writing and executing complex data pulls from SQL Server databases to support our operations and grow into performing database administrator duties.

Responsibilities

Develop and maintain complex SQL queries to extract data from SQL Server databases
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver accurate data pulls and reports
Ensure data integrity and security during the extraction process
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights relevant to P&C insurance operations
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Optimize database performance by identifying and resolving bottlenecks
Stay updated with the latest SQL Server technologies and best practices




Qualifications

5+ years of experience with SQL Server databases and advanced querying techniques.
Experience in Personal and Commercial insurance industry a plus
Proficient with Microsoft Office applications
Microsoft .Net experience a plus

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for entry-level data analysts who should be self-directed and will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business, covering a range of topics.




Position: Data Analyst

Hire Type: Fulltime on W2

Location: Ann Arbor, MI

Compensation: $80,000-$90,000 (Negotiable)

Eligible EAD: CPT-40, OPT, OPT-EXT, H1B, H4-EAD, L2S, GC.

Duration: Long Term

Contact: 307-227-8046 | soham@codersdata.com




About Us:

CodersData is a full-service placement firm that has been servicing client in America for the past 10+ years. We are dedicated towards fulfilling the IT needs of our clients. From recruiting to full implementation of projects, we provide the highest quality IT Services. We Intend to deliver exceptional student outcome. We don't just help you secure a tech job; we help you build a solid career in technology.




Job description:

Generate insightful analysis and visualizations suitable for both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Aid in the development, maintenance, and enhancement of the organization's data infrastructure and reporting environment.
Identify opportunities for enhancing data-driven decision-making processes across the organization.
Contribute to the enhancement and documentation of organizational data policies and procedures, ensuring alignment with industry best practices.
Perform external data reconciliation with regulatory affairs databases, ensuring accuracy and completeness.

Desired Candidate Profile:

A bachelor's or undergraduate degree is required.
Familiarity with programming languages like SQL, R, and Python, particularly in the banking and finance sectors,.
Proficiency in Tableau, Power BI, and Excel.
Strong leadership and planning skills, with the ability to navigate diverse business landscapes.
Ability to develop effective networks with internal and external stakeholders.
Preferred familiarity with Jira and Confluence.
Competence in managing and utilizing large datasets, with an understanding of data processing and analysis workflows.
Commitment to maximizing the power of diversity and inclusion.

Benefits:

Visa Sponsorship
On-the-job Technical support
E- verified
Long-Term Positions
401K
Medical Insurance
Dental Benefits
Vision Benefits
Paid Time Off (PTO)

Candidates who are missing the required skills might be provided an option to enhance their skills so that they can also apply for the role and make a career in the IT industry.




*****Freshers can also apply.

Title: Data Analyst Python (H/F)
Description:
Découvrez Novencia :

Expert en Data et Intelligence Artificielle, nous aidons nos clients à exploiter et à valoriser leurs données sous toutes ses formes en les accompagnant sur des projets de Data Analyse, Data Gourvernance, Data Architecture, Data Science, et Data Engineering…




Vous avez une solide expérience de minimum 4 ans sur Python et vous êtes à la recherche de nouveaux défis ? La suite pourrait donc vous intéresser !




Nous recherchons un Data Analyst Python (H/F)* talentueux et motivé pour rejoindre notre équipe dynamique. Le candidat idéal aura une solide expérience en analyse de données et une maîtrise des outils et bibliothèques Python. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec diverses équipes pour fournir des analyses pertinentes et soutenir la prise de décisions stratégiques.




Type de contrat : CDI

Lieu : Paris




Responsabilités :




- Collecter, nettoyer et analyser des ensembles de données complexes.

- Utiliser Python pour développer des modèles statistiques et des rapports analytiques.

- Collaborer avec les équipes internes pour identifier les besoins en données et fournir des solutions analytiques.

- Créer des tableaux de bord et des visualisations pour communiquer les résultats aux parties prenantes.

- Assurer la qualité et l'intégrité des données.

- Participer à l'amélioration continue des processus d'analyse de données.




Compétences et Qualifications :




- Diplôme en statistiques, mathématiques, informatique, économie ou dans un domaine connexe.

- Minimum de 4 années d'expérience en tant que Data Analyst.

- Expertise en programmation Python et en utilisation des bibliothèques de données (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.).

- Solide compréhension des concepts statistiques et des méthodes d'analyse.

- Compétence en gestion et manipulation de grandes bases de données.

- Excellentes compétences en communication et en présentation.

- Capacité à travailler de manière autonome et en équipe.

- Expérience avec des outils de visualisation de données (Tableau, Power BI ou autre) est un plus.




Notre objectif commun est de co-construire votre carrière en fonction de vos aspirations et de vos compétences.

Contactez-moi en message privé ou par mail au s.ziki@technologyandstrategy.com !




Let's make it possible #together




*Nos postes sont ouverts aux personnes bénéficiant d’une Reconnaissance de la Qualité de Travailleur Handicapé (RQTH). T&S Groupe encourage la diversité et l’égalité sur le lieu de travail. Tous les candidats qualifiés H/F/* sont pris en considération pour un emploi sur un même pied d'égalité.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My logistics client in Rotterdam are looking for a data analyst to join their growing team. They specialise in the transport of chemicals and are growing out their analytics capability, so are looking for an experienced profile who can help them make data-driven decisions




Responsibilities:

- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.




Requirements:

• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of PowerBI is ideal but not required

• Fluent Dutch-speaking

• Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:

• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)




Make sure to apply or reach me on the following:




Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Number: +31203997864

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?

As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 740 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise

With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data Analyst




It will be required to work in an agile method in collaboration with other members of the team to carry out the prioritized topics entrusted to the team.







YOUR MISSIONS:

Collaborate closely with the Product Owner, Development team, and other stakeholders to enhance interactions among all parties and ensure the squad's work is fully transparent.
Ensure that all events occur as planned, with attendees understanding their purpose, while helping everyone grasp the framework, its values, and best practices.
Act as a guardian between the development team and stakeholders, managing and filtering out inappropriate incoming requests and communications.
Promote and support value delivery throughout the tribe.
Facilitate tribe events and processes.
Assist squads in delivering value effectively.







YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:

Solid knowledge and experience in reporting and ETL development with Power BI and Alteryx
SQL development skills
PL/SQL development skills
Nice to have: SAP Business Objects,VBA, API, Python,
Fluent in English
French knowledge is a nice to have
Hybrid regime in the Porto office




🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Show more
